title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 630.3 - Services of center
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 630.3 - Services of center

State Regulations
(a) The center's program of services as defined in article 23-B of the Labor Law
shall be planned and operated in relation to present and future needs of
clientele. The services shall be of such quality and so applied that they
constitute an effective program which seeks the objectives of independence and
economic security for the individual displaced homemaker. (b) In establishing priorities for its
services, the center shall consider the needs, economic status and obstacles to
employment of each individual displaced homemaker. (c) The center may establish a schedule of
fees based on ability to pay for various services offered for participants who
do not meet the definition of displaced homemakers. The fee schedule shall be
subject to the approval of the Industrial Commissioner. Income from fees must
be used to defray the costs of this program. Only after the needs of displaced
homemakers clientele are satisfied may services be open to others for a
fee. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12

630.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
